meanings.definition: The quality or state of being transmissible.
meanings.sent1: The transmissibilities of the virus made it easily spread among the population.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the transmissibilities of the disease to understand how it spreads.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch exaggerated the transmissibilities of gossip in a hilarious way.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project had transmissibilities that inspired the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used visuals to explain the transmissibilities of sound waves to the students.

meanings.definition: The ability to be transmitted or passed on.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the transmissibilities of ideas is crucial for effective communication.
meanings.sent2: The transmissibilities of data through the internet have revolutionized information sharing.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the alien invasion had transmissibilities that spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent4: His charisma had transmissibilities that influenced everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the transmissibilities of emotions through his powerful paintings.
